meanings.definition: Force or drive someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The teacher compels the students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: His passion for music compels him to practice every day.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies compels me to enter the bakery.
meanings.sent4: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop compels visitors to take photos.
meanings.sent5: The urgent message on the billboard compels drivers to slow down.

meanings.definition: Cause someone to feel strongly compelled to do something
meanings.sent1: The heartfelt story compels the audience to tears.
meanings.sent2: The thrilling plot of the movie compels viewers to stay until the end.
meanings.sent3: The adorable puppy's playful antics compels laughter from everyone.
meanings.sent4: The powerful speech compels people to take action for change.
meanings.sent5: The captivating artwork compels admiration from all who see it.
